sentences.english: Li Chang, 53, was suspended pending an investigation.
sentences.chinese: 据了解，现年53岁的李昶停职后将面临调查。

sentences.english: You and your friend are off the job until further notice.
sentences.chinese: 你和你的朋友被停职了，除非另行通知。

sentences.english: Dismissals and suspensions have often taken place on the flimsiest of evidence.
sentences.chinese: 经常发生解雇和停职但是往往有缺乏证据。

sentences.english: Smith, who quit eight days after the incident, remains unrepentant.
sentences.chinese: 这个事件发生后，史密斯被停职了，但他不后悔。

sentences.english: The nurse involved has been suspended and the head of the hospital reprimanded.
sentences.chinese: 涉案的护士已遭停职处分，医院的院长也受到惩处。

sentences.english: Wooten was briefly suspended over the allegations in 2006 but never dismissed.
sentences.chinese: Wooten在2006年被停职但从未被开除。

sentences.english: Ally McBeal, bear all the responsibility to the south, has been suspended.
sentences.chinese: 东窗事发，向南承担了所有的责任，被停职。

sentences.english: Avon confirmed the suspensions but gave no details.
sentences.chinese: 雅芳证实了停职一事，但没有提供细节。

sentences.english: Chen has been suspended from his position.
sentences.chinese: 据悉，陈立岩已被责令停职。

sentences.english: The suspension of the prime minister of Tanzania.
sentences.chinese: 还有坦桑尼亚首相的停职。

sentences.english: You get that certificate here now, or you will cease to have your job.
sentences.chinese: 你现在就把证书给我送过来，要不你就会停职了。

sentences.english: Flees completely safe causes Ding Luoshan to suspend the inspection, Liu Yong becomes acts bureau chief.
sentences.chinese: 万全出逃导致丁洛山被停职检查，刘勇成为代理局长。

definition: to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
to discipline sb/to punish/disciplinary action/to deal with (a matter)/CL:個|个[ge4]
shuanggui, an extralegal system within the CCP for detaining and interrogating cadres who fall from grace
to charge (an entity) with (a task)/to assign (sb) the task of
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
lack of discipline/to break a rule/to violate discipline/to breach a principle
to keep an official position/to hold on to one's job
